text: 11th July 2016Level 42 botteshare. Thanks to Leighton. Almost clear gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and dry, decent carbonation. Mildly sweet malts. Tangy citrus and smooth floralness. Touches of hop skunk and lime peel. Pine. Smooth finish with mild bitter linger. Very smooth and drinkable.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of toast, floral hops, citrus, lighter pine. Taste of citrus, toffee, some tropical fruits, straw, dry finish.

Bottle shared at level 42 Canary wharf tasting. 11/07/2016. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. A lightly hazed bright yellow greeny coloured pour with a a lasting frothy white head. Aroma is green hop, pine needle, light dank, pale grains, little rubber Inner tube. Flavour is composed of pale grains, light straw, pine needle, da k hop. Palate is crisp, semi sweet, moderate carbonation, slight hop. Really quaff able.

500cl bottle shared at the July CW tasting, London. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. It pours a hazed straw color with a small white head. Aroma is prominently tangy citric and danky, with big notes of lemon peel, danky weed, grass, light onion, kumquats. Taste is also lightly fruity sweet and majorly tangy danky with notes of lemon peel, grass, dank, tangerine, light mango, straw. Light to medium bodied with lively carbonation. Not really a Pilsner but an excellent session IPA

Can shared at 42nd Floor, with thanks to Leighton. As Other Half / Creature Comforts Grits N Greens 5.9%. Hazy yellow, still, foamy beige head. Aroma is fairly dank, lightly pissy, rubbery, also some lime juice and fruit salad. Body is smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is light straw-like malt, some lemon, some grapefruit, dry finish.

Can big thanks to Leighton. It pours hazy yellow - gold with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, mellow, grassy, pine, nectarine, apricot, creaminess and white head. The taste is crisp, mellow bitterness, grassy, floral, white bread, creaminess, floral notes, cracker, lemon peel and pepper with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Very refreshing. Nice.

Can at Level 42 tasting, big thanks to Elkeyess, 11/07/16.
Hazed golden blonde with a decent off white head that collapses to a swirl.
Nose is punchy hops, dank strokes, grapefruit, melon, pissy citrics, straw.
Taste comprises juicy hops, lemon rind, citric kissed straw, melon, tangerine, skunky hop, grapefruit dance.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a skunky hop lick.
Super solid fayre but may as well be classed as a SIPA or an APA with this amount of hopping instead of grabbing a top 50 spot in a style it doesnt resemble!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can shared in London - many thanks to Sandino. Pours mostly clear yellow with a creamy, white head. Lovely aroma, juicy and fresh, with some lemon, biscuit, straw. Light sweet flavour with a subtle dank news, some grapefruit, melon, peach, hints of lemon peel. Light bodied with massaging carbonation. Juicy, citrusy on the finish, with understated biscuity malt, soft rindy bitterness, some pith, more grapefruit. Not a traditional pils, but incredible as hop juice. Delicious.

Draft at The Jeffrey. Clear gold, white head, decent lace. Spice, grains, and onion on the aroma. Flavor is fairly bitter. Drinks on the lighter side, with a longer, dry close. Tingly as well. Pretty good.

Draft at Pony Bar HK with Linh, Paul and Max. Pours a light golden body with no head, thin white lacing. Nose is soft hop profile. Mouthfeel is light and crisp with clean malt, soft fresh green hop and decent bitterness in the finish.
Draught @ the source. Lightly cloudy golden color with small foamy white head, low carbonation, medium bitter taste, smooth body, long crisp finish. Nicely hopped pilsner.
Precious Metal, Brooklyn tap: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is grass, grain, light citrus. Taste is noce and bitter. Very grassy and dirty. Lingering aftertaste. Pretty nice.

Can shared by Nick on 6/10/16, as a palate cleanser. Love it!Good clarity throughout the waxen-yellow-golden body. White head atop is medium-sized and shows average retention.Cereal grains in the nose are balanced by honey-like malts and whole lotta juicy hops...Wow, this is way better than the Other Half IPAs Ive had (which are not very many, tbf). Mango, soft pineapple and a more dry nectarine with no pine. Some dank, spicy character on the finish, as well, with no alcohol or flaws.While there are a ton of IPLs out there which are really nothing more than just IPAs with a lager yeast pitched at a colder temperature, and I have no idea how traditional the mash or fermentation was on this, I will say that, while the hops arent traditional, the body is excellently dry, with a light graininess and brisk, tight carbonation. The finish is crisp and moderately bitter. Loved the stuff. No resin/twang to it whatsoever.
Can. Pale yellow pour with white head. Kinda bland bitter hop notes dominate. Really one dimensional. Average body and mouthfeel.
Can at Matts. Pours hazy blonde with a white head. Aroma and taste are light, piney bitterness. Not bad.
Bottle - Nice citrus notes. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Light grain and some nice citrus notes. Nice .
Tasting at Matts, canCloudy blond color. The aroma has a grassy side and earthy, some manure. Smooth mouthfeel, some crisp malts, and citrusy hops.Not your typical Pilsner. Nice.
Pours a hazy straw colour with an off-white head. Aroma is fairly grassy, and a bit bready. Fresh hoppy flavour, great fruity notes with a clean and crisp finish. Very happy with this.

500mL can, pours a cloudy yellowish blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out toasted grains, fresh citrus hopping, and a little grass. Flavour is very fresh and un-pilsner-like, with lots of citrus hopping and toasted grains. Super fresh, with a lovely citrus hopping on the finish. Really nice stuff.

Pours a somewhat opaque golden yellow, white head. Aroma is pissy Nelson, grass, hay, wheat, grape must. Flavor is grits, grains, dank greens, grass, citrus fruits, funky grape. Light bodied beautifully fresh hoppy Pilsner... Lovely first shot at the style by OH!
Can - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of lime, citrus, pine, wheat and hoppy grass - medium body

Canned from a very recent release, about a week old. Pours slightly hazy yellow, white head. Aroma is lemon, slightly tart funk, citrus, grass, mild tropical note. Flavor is light lemon, pilsner malt, really nice and refreshing.
Can. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with medium creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is melon, grass, wheat. Medium body, dank, pine, strong bitterness, very good.
